revisions.rev:
{{NCAATeamSeason |Mode = Basketball |Year = 2010â11 |Prev year = 2009â10 |Next year = 2011â12 |Team = Gonzaga Bulldogs |Image = GU Bulldog.svg |Image_size = 150px |Conference = West Coast Conference |Division = |ShortConference = WCC |CoachRank = |APRank = |Record = 25–10 |ConfRecord = 11–3 |HeadCoach = [[Mark Few]] |HCYear = 12th |AsstCoach1 = [[Tommy Lloyd]] |AsstCoach2 = [[Ray Giacoletti]] |AsstCoach3 = [[Donny Daniels]] |StadiumArena = [[McCarthey Athletic Center]] |Champion =WCC Regular Season Co-Champions
[[2011 West Coast Conference Men's Basketball Tournament|WCC Tournament]] Champions |BowlTourney =[[2011 NCAA Men's Division I Basketball Tournament|NCAA Tournament]] |BowlTourneyResult = Third Round }} {{2010â11 West Coast Conference men's basketball standings}} The '''2010â11 [[Gonzaga Bulldogs men's basketball]] team''' represented [[Gonzaga University]] in the [[2010â11 NCAA Division I men's basketball season|2010â11]] [[college basketball]] season. The Bulldogs are members of the [[West Coast Conference]], and were led by head coach [[Mark Few]]. They played their home games at the [[McCarthey Athletic Center]] on the university campus in [[Spokane, Washington]]. The team lost the 2010 [[West Coast Conference Men's Basketball Player of the Year|WCC Player of the Year]] [[Matt Bouldin]] to graduation, but returned the rest of their starting lineup.{{cite press release|url=http://www.gozags.com/auto_pdf/p_hotos/s_chools/gonz/sports/m-baskbl/auto_pdf/2010-11MBXQUICKFACTS#00 |title=2010â11 Bulldogs Quick Facts |publisher=Gonzaga University Sports Information |accessdate=October 12, 2010}} Three of the returning players [[2010 FIBA World Championship squads|participated]] in the [[2010 FIBA World Championship]] in [[Turkey]]â[[Elias Harris]] for [[Germany national basketball team|Germany]] and [[Kelly Olynyk]] and [[Robert Sacre]] for [[Canada national men's basketball team|Canada]]. Gonzaga was the only NCAA school with more than one player involved in the 2010 Worlds. The Bulldogs finished the 2010â11 season 25â10, 11â3 in WCC play to share the regular season championship with [[2010â11 Saint Mary's College Gaels men's basketball team|Saint Mary's]]. They defeated Saint Mary's in the championship game of the [[2011 West Coast Conference Men's Basketball Tournament]] to earn an automatic bid in the [[2011 NCAA Men's Division I Basketball Tournament]]. As the 11 seed in the southeast region, the defeated 6 seed [[2010â11 St. John's Red Storm men's basketball team|St. John's]] in the second round before falling to 3 seed Brigham Young in the third round. ==Preseason== In 2010â11, the Gonzaga Bulldogs men's basketball team were in their 31st season as a member of the [[West Coast Conference]].{{cite web|url=http://www.wccsports.com/school-bio/west-school-bio.html|title=West Coast Conference History|publisher=[[CBS Interactive]]|accessdate=November 13, 2011}} Since 2004, the team has played their home games at the [[McCarthey Athletic Center]], which has a capacity of 6,000.{{cite web|url=http://www.gonzaga.edu/Academics/Libraries/Foley-Library/Departments/Special-Collections/exhibitions/GonzagaHistory1990.asp|title=Gonzaga History 1990-present|publisher=[[Gonzaga University]]|accessdate=November 13, 2011}} In their [[2009â10 Gonzaga Bulldogs men's basketball team|previous season]], a West Coast Conference Preseason poll predicted that the Gonzaga Bulldogs would finish first in the conference.{{cite web|url=http://www.wccsports.com/sports/m-baskbl/spec-rel/102209aac.html|title=Gonzaga Selected As Favorite In 2009-10 WCC Men's Basketball Preseason Coaches Poll|date=October 22, 2009|publisher=CBS Interactive|accessdate=November 13, 2011}} ==Roster== {{CBB roster/Header|year=2010|team=Gonzaga Bulldogs|teamcolors=n}} {{CBB
